title: Space Capital sees upside to 2022 decline in space investment
summary: Last year was rough for space startups. Overall investment dropped 58 percent from its $47.4 billion peak in 2021 to $20.1 billion in 2022.

title: NASA faces “difficult choices” for current and future Earth science missions
summary: The co-chair of the most recent Earth science decadal survey warned that NASA faces “difficult choices” between continuing current missions and starting new missions given limited funding.

title: ClearSpace raises $29 million ahead of first debris removal mission
summary: Swiss startup ClearSpace said Jan. 19 it has raised about $29 million to support its first space debris removal mission in 2026.

title: SpaceX delivers GPS satellite to 12,000-mile-high orbit
summary: SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket just after sunrise Wednesday from Cape Canaveral, hauling a GPS navigation satellite into orbit to replace an aging 16-year-old spacecraft in the global positioning network trusted to guide everything from military weapons to urban commuters.

title: Anuvu gets deal to resell Starlink to maritime customers amid Telesat uncertainty
summary: Mobile satellite connectivity specialist Anuvu said Jan. 17 it has signed a deal to resell Starlink services as plans to use a rival constellation proposed by Telesat remain uncertain.
